snippet: The weeks leading up to the anniversary of the Sept. 11, 1973, military coup that brought Gen. Augusto Pinochet to power have been marked with an avalanche of events and media coverage.
abstract: Tens of thousands of Chileans march through Santiago to commemorate 40th anniversary of bombing of presidential palace by Chilean Air Force, helping to overthrow elected socialist government and obliterate what had been one of South America's healthiest democracies; weeks leading up to anniversary have been marked with  avalanche of related events that some Chileans find emotionally exhausting.
lead_paragraph: The weeks leading up to the anniversary of the Sept. 11, 1973, military coup that brought Gen. Augusto Pinochet to power have been marked with an avalanche of events and media coverage.

headline.main: Chile Recalls Coup With Flurry of Events and New Openness
headline.print_headline: Chile Recalls Coup With Flurry of Events and New Openness
